«would»/«should»/«could», the general subjective subjunctive operator; used before an argument, usually a {lepo} clause, to give the accompanying predicate a subjunctive sense (PA). «would»/«should»/«could», as used in subjective subjunctive sentences in which the causal condition is missing. E.g. {Mi hapci mia ba.} -- I would be happy (in some mental place/under some unspecified condition x).
